result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas C Macemon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Thomas C Macemon is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Thomas C Macemon was found guilty of Homicide by Veh. Use-Control. Substance, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.09(1)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Take all medications as prescribed and follow all the orders of treating physicians. Do not drive unless properly licensed and approved by the agent. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program once he has served 13 years. Any assessments, counseling or treatment as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 25 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 1

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: **AMENDED 04-01-2020** to grant additional CFTS on Ct 2

superMiscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.   **CORRECTED 02-02-2021:  Defendant's date of birth was corrected.

Must not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required and shall be monitored by random UA's and breathalyzers. Must take any medications only as prescribed. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Do not drive without valid license, proof of insurance, and permission of agent.   No contact with the victims family (person, property, residence or family). Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Completion of Representation

IT IS ORDERED that this petition shall be deemed to be a timely but nonconforming petition for review. However, a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirements of Wis. Stat. 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by July 5, 2022. If the statement is not filed by that time, the matter will be summarily dismissed.

IT IS ORDERED that the judgments of the circuit court are summarily affirmed. WIS. STAT. RULE 809.21.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Pamela Moorshead is relieved of her obligation to further represent Thomas C. Macemon in this matter. See WIS. STAT. RULE 809.32(3).
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant  NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances.   Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - report to 524 S Main Street, Third Floor (262-632-1780).   Do not drive at all.   You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m.   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). SED   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
